body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

@hfp

The `libxsmm` doesn't specify a dependency on `binutils`, so a (potentially old) system binutils is used and the build fails:

```
$ as --version
GNU assembler version 2.25.1-22.base.el7
$ spack install libxsmm
Error: no such instruction: ...
```

I'm not an expert here, so is the right thing to do to add a dependency on `binutils`?

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.17.1-663-3cd599d6f6
* **Python:** 3.8.7
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-haswell
* **Concretizer:** clingo

### Additional information

_No response_

### General information

- [X] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [X] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and **@mentioned** any maintainers
- [X] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: libxsmm
